NF.Q: Which pairs of nodes in the chord chart have a flow greater than 220? Please list the source node, target node, and the corresponding flow value.
NF.A: There is a flow of {224} from {Potter.com} to {DuffyLLCOnline}, a flow of {232} from {AtkinsonExpress} to {DuffyLLCOnline}.

NF.Q: Which pairs of nodes in the chord chart have a flow less than 14? Please list the source node, target node, and the corresponding flow value.

NF.Q: Which pairs of nodes in the chord chart have a flow between 71 and 110? Please list the source node, target node, and the corresponding flow value.

NC.Q: Which flow is larger: from Potter.com to DanielsGroupShop or from Potter.com to DuffyLLCOnline?
NC.A: The flow from {Potter.com} to {DuffyLLCOnline} is larger.

NC.Q: Which flow is the largest: from DuffyLLCOnline to DanielsGroupShop, from DuffyLLCOnline to Potter.com, or from GillespieShop to DuffyLLCOnline?
NC.A: The flow from {GillespieShop} to {DuffyLLCOnline} is the largest.

MSR.Q: Which category has the highest proportion of outgoing flow relative to its total flow?

MSR.Q: Which pair has the strongest chord connection in this chord chart?
MSR.A: The strongest chord connection is between {DanielsGroupShop} and {Potter.com}.

VA.Q: To minimize the crossings between chords, please reorder the outer arcs and list the reorder arc order in clockwise direction.
VA.A: The reordered arc order in clockwise direction is: {Arc GillespieShop, Arc Potter.com, Arc DanielsGroupShop, Arc DuffyLLCOnline, Arc AtkinsonExpress}.
